BD-STEP is a two-year fellowship opportunity managed jointly by the National Cancer Institute and the Veterans Health Administration that uses data science to improve outcomes for cancer patients. Competitively selected postdoctoral fellows work with VA Medical Center clinicians and interdisciplinary researchers to address important questions in cancer research and care. The program offers an avenue to access rich, diverse cancer data resources, including diagnosis and treatment information from the VA Central Cancer Registry and longitudinal, clinical data from the VA’s national healthcare system. The combination of data access, academic mentorship, and clinical guidance equips BD-STEP graduates with the diverse skillsets they need to pursue careers in healthcare data science.


Interested postdoctoral fellows should talk to their academic supervisors about the program, discussing the time commitment and their desire to participate. They should also consider the VA Medical Center locations where on-site training and research will occur for accepted BD-STEP fellows. For more program details, please visit https://cssi.cancer.gov/bd-step and https://www.va.gov/oaa/specialfellows/programs/sf_bdstep.asp


  1. Please have your academic mentor (existing or planned research relationship) complete a letter of support for participation in the program. Note, applications will not be accepted without mentor’s endorsement.
  2. Compose a brief statement (no more than one page) describing interest and fit within the program, including proposed research areas and topics.
  3. Complete application and submit the following materials:
    • Letter of support from academic mentor
    • Statement of interest
    • Curriculum Vitae (CV)

Deadline for Applications June 1, 2019
Notification of selection July, 2019
Kickoff event October 1, 2019
